Name: Kite
Description: The kite, a bird of prey, is one of the manifestations of the sisters Isis and Nephthys at the bier of the dead Osiris, protecting his body.The facial markings are those of a falcon and a broad collar is depicted around the chest and wings as a wide yellow band. Back, wings and tail have been covered by a blue net (perhaps imitating the bead net that adorned the mummy) on a red background.Carved birds like this one were part of the tomb equipment in the Late Period. They were placed on mummiform coffins, canopic chests, funerary stelae and on the bases of Ptah-Sokar-Osiris statues, and protected the deceased with their magic.
